fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
 Customers would like to have REST API documentation for Insight Discovery tool, this will be helpful when they need to understand to extract custom information from the connected tool.

*+Use Case+*: While scanning the printers if the users prefer to add custom fields for SNMP walk. The SNMP data out of the box, used to scan devices such as Printers, Scanners is pretty limited. This is because every vendor can use SNMP MIBs in their own way. We cannot know in advance which numbers are delivering the specific information that users would like to retrieve.

The SNMP pattern delivered with Discovery only have the MIB Information for some default SNMP Devices, will be difficult for customers to build their own custom patterns for use cases. If there is awareness on how too fetch required information from Insight Discovery API's, then customers could leverage this to meet their requirements.

Also this will be useful for many scenarios, where customer would like to use customizations.

*Suggested Solution*
 Implement and document REST APIs that can be used by users to manage data using Insight Discovery tool.
fields.summary: Insight Discovery REST API Documentation

h3. Issue Summary

Insight makes use of deprecated code which is not compatible with the CDN functionality of Jira Data Center.

 # Configure the CDN functionality for Jira using the instructions available [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configure-your-cdn-for-jira-data-center-974378841.html]

h3. Expected Results

No health check warnings are raised by Insight.

h3. Actual Results

The CDN tool has a warning informing that Insight is not fully compatible with CDN.

 !Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 1.17.03 PM.png|thumbnail!

However, no functionality seems to be affected by this warning.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight custom field corrupt workflow transition when set as 1st in the screen order.

The issue is intermittent and the root cause is still unclear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight custom field with whatever filter.
 # Associate the field to a screen and set the field to be 1st in the order for the given screen.
 # Associate the screen to a transition in the workflow.
 # Create a new issue and then hit the transition where the screen is associated to.
 # When the screen appear, clic on the button to transition the issue.
 # Observe that the Insight custom field dropdown list open up and the transition operation continue to spin.
# Sometimes the transition is executed but still the Insight Custom field list dropdown open up.

 [^Screen Recording 2021-08-03 at 17.36.08.mov] 

Nothing is into logs regarding this.

A similar issue was reported here : [Insight CF Dropdown is opened immediately on the Create Screen|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-7282]

h3. Expected Results
The transition should execute and the Insight custom field dropdown list should not appear.
h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the transition execute but the Insight custom field dropdown list appear and sometimes the transition is not even executed.

h3. Workaround

Only workaround for now is to cancel and repeat the transition, since the issue is intermittent
fields.summary: Insight custom field corrupt workflow transition when set as 1st in the screen order

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Reports in Insight consume system resources, and if a report is sufficiently complex then the resource utilization may be significant. This can create an unintended performance impact to other users on the same Jira instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add some kind of validation or warning when creating a new report in Insight to alert the user that their report may consume significant system resources. The user can then wait for a quiet window to execute the report and avoid the potential for unintended impact.
fields.summary: Performance validation for new Insight reports

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Per the documentation at [Reports|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Reports#Reports-Creatinganewreport], any Insight user with access to a given Object Schema or type of Object may create reports with no special permissions.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a way for an Insight Admin to restrict reporting permissions to specific users.
h3. Why this is important

Reports consume system resources, and reports of sufficient size and complexity can unintentionally create performance problems for other users on the same Jira instance.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to restrict access to creating new reports in Insight

fields.description:
In the situation where Object A references Object B which references Object C, on a Jira issue with a field that references Object A, we want to display an attribute from Attribute C.

Using dot notation is not an available solution – see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-8520

To solve this problem, we
 # Created Insight custom field FieldA to hold one or more objects of ObjectType A.
 # Created Insight Readonly field FieldC that
 ## Has a Filter Scope for ObjectType C
 ## Has a Filter Assign Scope that assigns value based on contents of Field A

The results:
 # If FieldA had one value, FieldC showed the proper object
 # If FieldA had more than one object, FieldC could not render.

 

Desired result: FieldC can be multi-valued to match all values in FieldA.
fields.summary: Allow Insight Readonly custom field to be multi-valued

fields.description:
Since Jira 8.2, we improved the compliance of Jira Server with GDPR and one of the changes is that the format of userkey has changed to JIRAUSERxxxxx. Before this, userkey is the same as the username when it's first created. All new users created after this change will adopt the new userkey format.

Insight REST APIs like [this one|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#objectattribute_create_post] requires userkey and support userkey only. This could result in some errors retrieving/setting the expected users if username is used instead of userkey for users created after the changes since Jira 8.2.

The suggestion is to support using both userkey and username for ease of use.
fields.summary: Insight APIs to support either userkey or username as the value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is connected to 2 Confluence server instances via an application link, the Knowledge Base search functionality might not work from the main Help Center page, while it will still work from the individual portal search page and the request creation page.

Currently, Help Center search performs the search exclusively on the Primary Confluence instance and no other. 

This is a request to able to resolve this - through either -
 # Provide the ability to select which confluence instance is used in the Help Center searches
 # Or enable ability to search on all connected Connies

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Setup 2 Confluence instances
 -- The first one will be referred to as *Confluence*
 -- The second one will be referred to as *Confluence 2*
 - Create a new space in *Confluence*, and create a few pages containing the word "laptop"
 - Setup 1 Jira instance
 - Configure 2 application links in *Jira > ⚙ > Applications > Application Links*, 1 to each Confluence instance, with the application link to *Confluence* set to the primary one:
 !Step1.png|thumbnail!
 - Create a Service Desk project in Jira, and configure there a knowledge base using the space coming from *Confluence*
 !Step2.png|thumbnail!
 - Go to the main help center page of the customer portal (<JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals)
 - Type "laptop" in the search, and notice that the search is returning articles coming from *Confluence* (in addition to the relevant *Request Types* from JSD projects)
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 - Go back to *Jira > ⚙ > Applications > Application Links* and now set *Confluence 2* as the primary link
 !Step4.png|thumbnail!
 - Go back to the main help center page of the customer portal (<JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals)
 - Type "laptop" in the search

h3. Actual Results
 - The search does not return any article from *Confluence*, but only the relevant *Request Types* from JSD projects:
 !Step5.png|thumbnail!
 - When opening the Browser Dev tool, we can see that no pages are returned from the request <JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/shared/search?resultsPerPage=3&pageNumber=1&query=laptop&_=1627633567284
{code:java}
{"results":[],"total":0,"pageNumber":0,"resultsPerPage":0,"isCloud":false}
{code}
!Step6.png|thumbnail!

 - When enabling the debugging package *org.apache.http* in Logging And profiling, we don't see any outbound HTTP request sent from Jira to Confluence, which shows that the Jira application did not try to send any request to Confluence to search for these articles

h3. Expected results
 - The search should be returning articles coming from *Confluence* (in addition to the relevant *Request Types* from JSD projects)
 - When enabling the debugging package *org.apache.http* in Logging And profiling, we should see Jira sending outgoing HTTP requests to Confluence to search for the key word "laptop" within the Confluence space linked to the JSD project. For example:
{code:java}
2021-07-30 07:54:36,610+0200 http-nio-8093-exec-10 url: /jira8130/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/shared/search; user: julien DEBUG julien 474x2108x1 znpp6o 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/shared/search [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-1392 >> "GET /confluence712/rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&queryString=%28laptop%29+AND+%28spacekey%3ANEWIT+OR+spacekey%3AAB+OR+spacekey%3AGERMANIT+OR+spacekey%3AKBFOR%29&pageSize=3&startIndex=0&highlight=true&xoauth_requestor_id=julien HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]"
{code}

h3. Workaround

Set the Confluence application which is used as the Knowledge Base as the primary application link in *Jira > ⚙ > Applications > Application Links*.
fields.summary: Return Help Center articles from multiple knowledge bases if you have more than one connected to your Jira Service Management instance

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight Discovery seems to be unable to get the VM's IP address from the HyperV
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have VMs configured in a HyperV SW (e.g. VM1, VM2).
 # Set up the Discovery tool to scan a single IP of the Host running as Hyper V (HVHost)
 # In the Common Tab, Make sure to uncheck "Delete VM Guests" and check "Try VM Guest Scan"
 # Execute a Scan and import the results into Insight

h3. Expected Results

The Scan is imported, with 3 Hosts Created:
HVHost, VM1, VM2
Where VM1, VM2 are showing HVHost as a reference in their Hypervisor attribute

VM Guest Objects are created for VM1, VM2
h3. Actual Results

Only HVHost object is created.
VM Guest Objects are created for VM1, VM2 with reference to the HyperV but NO Network Interface
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Include the VM's IP Addresses in the Scan Settings in addition to the HVHost IP Address - so that the VMs will be scanned as any other Host.
This will create a Host Object for each VM - flagged as Virtual, but will not show the HyperV on them
fields.summary: Discovery Scan imported and not showing a reference from a VM to the Hypervisor hosting it

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is under high load from user actions (issue edit, comment, etc), rows are inserted into the AO_319474_MESSAGE table.

If the rate of message consumption is less than the rate of messages being added, this table grows to a very large size.

When queue's are accessed, JSM issues a count(*) query against the AO_319474_MESSAGE table that can be expensive depending on the database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set dark feature {{sd.internal.base.db.backed.completion.events.enabled}}
 # Place a high load into Jira, such that the MESSAGE table grows very large (for instance, 800K rows)
 # Observe {{select * from pg_stat_activity}} and note the high load against the database from the statement below.

h3. Expected Results

This bottleneck is not present.
h3. Actual Results

The following query is highly active on the database:
{noformat}
select count(*) from "public"."AO_319474_MESSAGE" "AO_319474_MESSAGE" where "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."QUEUE_ID" = ?
and ("AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT" is null or "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT" is not null
and ("AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT_TIME" is null or "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT_TIME" < ?)
{noformat}
Resource contention can occur and affect the performance of Jira.
h3. Workaround

Disable off-thread functionality by setting:
{code:java}
sd.internal.bounded.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled
sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled {code}
fields.summary: High issue activity can cause pressure on database due to count(*) statement on AO_319474_MESSAGE

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the {{sd.internal.base.db.backed.completion.events.enabled}} dark feature is enabled, JSM uses the "DB backed" off thread system. The thread pool used to consume events added to PSMQ is named SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor-n

This pool is fixed to a size of 5, which breaks scaling message consumption when this pool type is in effect.

Customers who have a significant amount of issue events (update/comment etc) could  find that this fixed pool size is not enough to consume events more than they are added, leading to an infinite build up of the {{AO_319474_MESSAGE}} table
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Dark Feature {{sd.internal.base.db.backed.completion.events.enabled}} 
 # Put load onto Jira
 # Note that the thread pool is fixed to 5
 # (i) Setting the defined workaround to increase the SdOffThreadEventJobRunner pool size, [sd.event.processing.async.thread.pool.count|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocking-in-jira-service-management-when-frequently-updating-the-same-issue-979428323.html] has no effect

h3. Expected Results

It's not clear. If we expect the previous workaround to take effect, the workaround should result in.

If not, then, we should add a new property to define the pool size - preferably, one that does not require DB manipulation.
h3. Actual Results

The pool size is fixed and does not grow

h3. Workaround

It is not possible to increase the SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor pool size. 

The only options are to either:
 * Go back to the deadlock risk SdOffThreadEventJobRunner pool, by removing the dark feature {{internal.base.db.backed.completion.events.enabled}}
 * Disable off-threading completely by setting dark features
{code}
sd.internal.bounded.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled
sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled
{code}
fields.summary: SdSerialisedOffThreadProcessor thread pool is fixed to 5 threads and cannot be increased

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Service Management Mail Handler (configured in *Project Settings > Email Requests*) automatically overwrites the *username* field with the value from the *email address* field when switching from the *Microsoft* tab to the *Other* tab (this behavior is intended by design).

(!) Note that the overwriting of the user name only occurs in the UI, but not in the Database, unless the *Update* button is clicked on. For this reason, this behavior does not impact the actual Mail Server configuration used by the Service Desk Mail Handler (which is stored in the Database).

h3. Environment

This behavior was replicated in Service Management 4.13.0, but it could be impacting older versions too.

h3. Steps to replicate

- Create a Service Management project
- Configure a shared mailbox in *Project Settings > Email Requests* using the *Other* tab with
-- testsharedmailbox@test.com as the *email address*
-- userwithmailboxaccess@test.com\testsharedmailbox as the *username*
- Click on the update button, and make sure that the connection is successful
- Click on the *Microsoft* tab, then switch back to the *Other* tab

 [^Screen Recording.mov] 

h3. Expected results

The *username* field should stay the same and should not be modified.


h3. Actual results

The *username* field will be overwritten with the value from the *email address* field when switching from the *Microsoft* tab to the *Other* tab:
- testsharedmailbox@test.com is showing as the *email address*
- testsharedmailbox@test.com is also showing as the *username*

(!) Note that this issue can sometimes be replicated by:
- opening any Jira page outside the Service Management project 
- then going back to *Project Settings > Email Requests* page
- in some cases, the *Outlook* tab will be selected by default, and when selecting the *Other* tab, the username will be overwritten by the email address


h3. Suggestion

Modify the way the username is displayed in the UI when switching from the *Microsoft* tab to the *Other* tab, as it can be very confusing from the Project Admin, because it looks like the incorrect username is being used in the *Email Request* configuration (while it is correct in the Database).
fields.summary: The Service Management Mail Handler automatically overwrites the username field with the value from the email address field (UI bug)

h3. Issue Summary
IQL Date function to search for objects with a past date returns date in future with year range 2042 to 9999

 # Set the value of the Date attribute to some date range 2042 to 9999. To make sure the year is registered as it is, enter the 4-digit year.
 !image-2021-07-22-17-14-57-136.png|thumbnail!

 # After the creation of the objects, search with IQLs below with the attribute name replaced accordingly.
{code}

{code}

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight automation fails to take action when triggered by any bulk operation viz., Object Import, Bulk Delete etc.

Please review the steps to reproduce to understand the issue better.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new objects via Insight GUI
 2. Configure Insight Automation with Rest execution on object Delete from Insight
 3. via Insight GUI delete created objects using Bulk Action
 4. bulk action don't execute any REST request (GET/POST/DELETE) to ex. remotesystemAPI
h3. Expected Results

Automation is triggered whenever there is a matching condition found.
h3. Actual Results

Automation gets triggered but the "_then_" action is not taken. We kind of understand why this could be happening.

Few attributes like (affected products, Metrics) are getting updates either after several minutes or hours after the object is created (as part of the import). The attributes are not updated as part of object creation. Since the 'if condition' is triggered only during the create event and not the update event, we are not seeing JIRA tickets created.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight Automation does not take action when IF condition is met via bulk delete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Discovery Tool is using mono when executing icmp commands from the Discovery Tool during a Scan / Evaluation Test.

When attempting to scan a Linux Host from Discovery running on a Linux Host using an IPv6 address - the ICMP Ping will fail in Discovery, but succeeds from the command prompt.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a Linux host with an IPv6 Address.
 # Set up the Discovery tool on another Linux machine
 # Ping the IPv6 Address from the Discovery Server - success
 # Configure a scan setting with the IPv6 Address to scan
 # try to generate an Evaluation report or execute a scan of this IPv6 Host

h3. Expected Results

The target Host responds to a ping and it can be scanned by the Discovery tool
h3. Actual Results

The Evaluation Test shows the Target host as unreachable / the scan fails with an error - method is not recognised.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Our devs have identified an issue with the mono library, which does not support the execution of the ICMP request.

As a workaround; install the Discovery on a Windows machine - IPv6 scans are successful.
fields.summary: Cannot scan a Linux Host from Discovery running on a Linux Host if using IPv6

h3. Issue Summary

With [this bug fix|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3597], customer notifications like *Customer-visible status changed / Public comment added* are complying to the format defined in *Email from* global Jira settings but the *Request Created* customer notification is using the JSM portal name as its *"From:"* header.

The *Request Created* customer notification that originate from 'Raise this request on behalf of' is complying to the format defined in *Email from* global Jira settings but this is not the case for customer notification triggered from customer's self-created request.

This is specific to a use case where we want a static string in the *"From:"* header.

 # *Jira administration » System » General configuration:*  ** Update *Email from*  with a static string like 'IT Support'
 # Log into the customer portal as customer
 # Create a new request
 # Check the customer notification

The *Request created* customer notification's "*From:"* header complies to the format defined in *Email from* global Jira settings.
h3. Actual Results

The *Request created* customer notification is using the JSM portal name as its "*From:"* header.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding attachments in JSD, JSD automatically increments + appends a number suffix even if the file does not exists
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Jira 8.6.0/JSD 4.6.0
 # Browse > select files, in the "Add attachment" pop up, cancel the the upload
 # Do the same thing again, observe that the number suffix is added, it is also incremented if this is operation is done repeatedly.
 # Try creating a new issue, perform the same steps above and observe the number suffix is added, even if the attachments do not exist on the new issue.

Video clip demonstration: [^Recording #4.mp4]

Additional note:
 * Once the above happens, try attaching the same files in another Business or Software type project, the number suffix will also be automatically added, even on a different project type/issue.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not append the number suffix, since the attachment with the same name does not exists.
h3. Actual Results

Jira appends a number suffix, even on a new issue without any attachments
h3. Workaround

Disable the following feature flags in Jira.
 _sd.attachment.generate.unique.suffix.when.attachment.filename.clash.occurs_
 _com.atlassian.jira.attachments.generate.unique.suffix_

This should look like this: 

!Screen Shot 2021-07-13 at 10.16.45 am.png|width=550,height=286!

Read how to do this here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
fields.summary: When adding attachments (in JSD queue view), Jira automatically increments + appends a number suffix even if the file does not exists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *View article in new window* link is incorrect when a Knowledge Base article is opened from the agent view, after sharing it as a comment. Instead of pointing to the actual KB article URL, it points to <JIRA_BASE_URL>/browse/null.
h3. Environment

Replicated using:
 - Jira 8.13.0 / JSM 4.13.0 (also replicable using Jira 8.16.0 / JSM 4.16.0)
 - Confluence Server 7.2.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link between Jira Server and Confluence Server
 # In Confluence, create a new space, and create an article in this space with the title "laptop"
 # In Jira:
 ## Create a new Service Management project
 ## Go to *Project Settings > Knowledge Base*, and select the space from the Confluence Server application to be used as a knowledge base space
 ## Create a new Jira issue in this project, with "laptop" as the summary
 ## Notice that the KB article created in Confluence is now listed in the *Related Knowledge Base Articles* panel
 ## Click on the *Share as comment* button next to this KB article. A comment will be added to the ticket, with a link to this KB article
 !KB_Article_SharedAsComment.png|thumbnail!
 ## Click on the KB article link in the comment. A pop-up will appear, with the content of the KB article. (Note that if you hover over the *View article in new window* link, you'll see an incorrect URL at the bottom of the browser)
 !KB_Article_IncorrectLink1.png|thumbnail!
 ## Click on the *View article in new window* link at the bottom of the pop-up

h3. Expected Results

A new tab will be opened, using the KB article URL
h3. Actual Results

A new tab is opened, using the broken URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/browse/null
 !KB_Article_IncorrectLink2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Note

This issue does not occur when the KB article is clicked on from the *Related Knowledge Base Articles* panel. In this case, the proper URL is used by the *View article in new window* link
 !KB_Article_CorrectLink.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

To view the KB article, click on it from the *Related Knowledge Base Articles* panel instead of from the comment.
fields.summary: An incorrect URL is used in the "article in new window" link when a Knowledge Base article is opened from the agent view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight Automation to create issue will not work when there is a required custom field with default value 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Object Scheme;
# Create an automation in this Object Scheme to create an issue in a specific Project; (eg, When a comment is added, then create an issue)
# Create a single select custom field, add it to Project A screens and field scheme;
# Make this field required;
# Set a default value.

h3. Expected Results
The automation should be able to create an issue in the target project using the default value

h3. Actual Results
Issues are not created by automation.


h3. Workaround

Removing the required field from the default screen or create issue screen will workaround the issue and the automation should work.

Alternatively, you can use HTTP Request instead of Create Issue in the automation Action and then use the [create issue End Point|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.18.0/#api/2/issue-createIssues] in the URL with a POST. In the POST data, you can include the JSON Payload with the required field filled in
fields.summary: Insight Automation to create issue will not work when there is a required custom field with default value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Filter issue scope for Insight custom field is not respected when selecting a preset value in JSM request types

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a schema and an object type containing 2 additional attributes. Ex. one *Project* type attribute and one *Status* Type attribute:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.24.43.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create some objects with *different values* for Status and Project attributes. Ex:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.26.27.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an Insight custom field set on the previously created schema and object type and try to set the *Filter Issue Scope either on one Status for the attribute created or one project* (ex Status = ("Active") or Project = currentProject()):
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.27.40.png|thumbnail! 
OR
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.30.58.png|thumbnail! 
# Assign the Insight field to the screen of a JSM project (ex. PRESET which is the value I populated the Project type attribute with).
# Try to create an issue in PRESET project and observe that only three objects are proposed in order to respect the Filter Issue scope:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.29.51.png|thumbnail! 
# Enter the PRESET project settings and edit one request type to add this example Insight custom field.
# Keep the field hide and so that is mandatory to fill it with preset value. Observe that all objects are proposed as preset value for the object type and the Filter Issue Scope is not respected:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 16.29.13.png|thumbnail! 

This happen both in the case of Status and Project filter for the filter issue scope.

This looks similar but slightly different from [ICS-1577|https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1577], previously fixed in Insight 8.4.4.

In this case whenever the issue is raised from within the portal, the wrong value is also shown:

 !Screenshot 2021-07-13 at 17.04.03.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Expected Results
The preset value drop down menu should respect the Filter Issue Scope.

h3. Actual Results
Filter Issue scope is not respected

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter issue scope for Insight custom field is not respected when selecting a preset value in JSM request types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Performing an Insight import of type "Jira Environment Import" does not import user's last login time information.

h3. Suggested Solution

Include a user's last login attempt date/time in the Jira Users Import section of the Jira Environment Import.
 
h3. Workaround 

It is possible to configure a [Database Import|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/database-import-33467084.html] to capture this information. Specific queries can be found at: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/find-the-last-login-date-for-a-user-in-jira-server-363364638.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/find-the-last-login-date-for-a-user-in-jira-server-363364638.html].

For this to work, it is necessary to specify "u.display_name AS "Name"," in the SELECT of your SQL because "Name" will be needed in order to have the data locator linked to your label.
fields.summary: Include last login attempt in Jira Users Import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For [Readonly Insight Custom Field|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/readonly-insight-custom-field-33466906.html], "*Filter Assign Scope (IQL)*" only takes affect for newly created/updated issues as the filter only gets _triggered_ upon a IssueCreated or IssueUpdated events.

As a result, as a Jira/Insight administrator it's difficult to automatically populate the "Readonly Insight Custom Field" values for existing issues until these issues are manually updated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few Jira issues first
 # Add a Readonly Insight Custom Field and add to the relevant screens
 # Add *Filter Assign Scope (IQL)*

h3. Expected Results

Existing issues also changes the custom field value
h3. Actual Results

Existing issues would not change the RO Insight custom field unless they're updated.
h3. Workaround

[Possible workaround bash script in community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/Trigger-quot-Filter-Assign-Scope-quot-retroactively-Possible/ba-p/1747800#M868]
fields.summary: Add ability to trigger "Filter Assign Scope" retroactively for existing issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Requests number in the user dropdown cannot be seen if banner background colour is closed to white
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a project with customer portal enabled. Create some issues so the number of requests is larger than 0.
 # Go to project settings, then portal settings.
 # Click `View and customize the look and feel of your Help Center.`
 # Change Banner background to `#ffffff`.
 # Click the user profile dropdown, the `My requests` with number text is now white and matched the background white which makes the number unreadable.
 # Change Banner background to `#239227`.
 # Click the user profile dropdown, the "number of requests" text is now readable. (see screenshots attached).

h3. Expected Results

Whatever banner background (light or dark) that the user chose, it should use the contrast colour to show the number of notifications in readable colour.
h3. Actual Results

When the banner background is white or closed to white, the number of requests is unreadable because its colour is matching the background.
h3. Workaround

Customers can change the banner background to some colour that is not closed to white which will work as a workaround.
fields.summary: Requests number in the customer portal user dropdown cannot be seen if banner background colour is close to white

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [AWS Insight integration|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218757/insight-aws-integration?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] identifies [a great deal of information about AWS hosts|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/IAWI/Data+imported+into+Insight], but it does not discover or identify installed applications on those hosts. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the AWS integration to identify installed applications, similar to Insight Discovery.

h3. Why this is important

Using multiple applications to gather details about the same hosts is cumbersome and creates administrative overhead that is not desired.
 
h3. Workaround 

Using both apps (the AWS Integration along with Insight Discovery), it is possible to gather the information needed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, Jira Software Data Center, and Jira Service Management Data Center exposed a Ehcache RMI network service which attackers, who can connect to the service, on port 40001 and potentially 40011 [0][1][2], could execute arbitrary code of their choice in Jira through deserialization due to a missing authentication vulnerability. While Atlassian strongly suggests restricting access to the Ehcache ports to only Data Center instances, fixed versions of Jira will now require a shared secret in order to allow access to the Ehcache service.

*[0]* In Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center versions prior to 7.13.1, the Ehcache object port can be randomly allocated.

*[1]* In Jira Service Management Data Center versions prior to 3.16.1, the Ehcache object port can be randomly allocated.

*[2]* The default Ehcache port is 40001 but it can be configured to be on a different port, see [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html#InstallingJiraDataCenter-parametersCluster.propertiesfileparameters] for more details.

 

*Affected versions:*
 The versions of Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center affected by this vulnerability are:
 * From version 6.3.0 before 8.5.16 (the fixed version for 8.5.x)
 * From version 8.6.0 before 8.13.8 (the fixed version for 8.13.x)
 * From version 8.14.0 before 8.17.0

 

The versions of Jira Service Management Data Center affected by this vulnerability are:
 * From version 2.0.2 before 4.5.16 (the fixed version for 4.5.x)
 * From version 4.6.0 before 4.13.8 (the fixed version for 4.13.x)
 * From version 4.14.0 before 4.17.0

h3. Fixed Versions

To address these issues, we have released Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center:
 * 8.5.16 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 8.13.8 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 8.17.0 that contains a fix for this issue

 

Jira Service Management Data Center versions:
 * 4.5.16 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 4.13.8 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 4.17.0 that contains a fix for this issue

 

These versions can be downloaded at:
 * Jira Core Server: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/core/download]
 * Jira Software Data Center: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update]
 * Jira Service Management Data Center: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-management/update]

h3. Additional details

For additional details, see the full advisory: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-data-center-and-jira-service-management-data-center-security-advisory-2021-07-21-1063571388.html]
fields.summary: Jira Data Center & Jira Service Management Data Center -  Missing Authentication for Ehcache RMI - CVE-2020-36239

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the Jira Service Desk Email Processor Plugin checks the following items in a email header to determine whether to create or comment an issue:


* Subject header - trying to find the issue key and add a comment there
* In-Reply-To header - trying to match the Message-ID value (with the ones in the notificationinstance table) in order to find the issue ID to add a comment to
* References header - same as the previous one
* Message-ID header - same as the previous one


Admins should have the ability to adjust this by the project in case they want issues to always be created regardless of the old reference.

A scenario where this would be useful is: There is an old closed case and we need to create a new one by forwarding the email history. If the email has an old issue key, Jira will comment the old case instead of creating a new one.
fields.summary: Allow the customization of what the plugin checks in the header for a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Much longer time needed for imports in Insight version 8.6.12 and above. This also causes CPU spike up to 99% and the import process may seem halted on the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With Insight 8.6.11, set up and import from the CVE-Database as per [this documentation|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INVDI/Importing+Data+into+Insight]. For testing purpose, we choose CVE 2020.
 # Note the time taken to complete the import.
 # Upgrade to Insight 8.6.12 or any newer version, create another schema and perform the exact same import.
 # Note the time taken to complete the import and the CPU usage.

h3. Expected Results
The time taken to complete the import in both versions is almost the same

h3. Actual Results
* It takes much longer to complete the import in Insight version 8.6.12 and above. Based on the comparison of the logs, we can see that the step to decide actions for all objects is *taking more time* in the newer Insight versions (103ms vs 401608ms). 
* *CPU spike* can also be observed along the import process especially on step 3 (decide actions for all objects) and as soon as the import is done, CPU usage is back to normal. Due to the much longer process, the impact of CPU spike is amplified.
(i) In some cases, the import seems halted for hours on step 3 and CPU usage is constantly at its peak. The import has to be terminated manually by canceling the import, disabling and re-enabling Insight or restart Jira.
h4. Insight 8.6.11
{code}
2021-07-08 13:47:39,598 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | NVD>>> Mapped all data to internal objects in 62805 ms
2021-07-08 13:47:39,702 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | NVD>>> Decided actions for all objects in 103 ms
2021-07-08 13:47:39,702 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | NVD>>> Objects to import 38801
...
2021-07-08 13:55:50,762 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | Handled 32200 objects with outbound references
2021-07-08 13:55:50,763 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | Finished updating object references in 250704 ms
2021-07-08 13:55:50,763 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-0] | NVD>>> Finished import with id 18 of type insight-cve-import at time 2021-07-08T13:55:50.763233. Import took 660570 ms
{code}

h4. Insight 8.6.12 and above
{code}
2021-07-08 11:26:05,055 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | NVD>>> Mapped all data to internal objects in 59958 ms
2021-07-08 11:32:46,664 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | NVD>>> Decided actions for all objects in 401608 ms
2021-07-08 11:32:46,664 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | NVD>>> Objects to import 38254
...
2021-07-08 11:40:27,822 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | Handled 31326 objects with outbound references
2021-07-08 11:40:27,823 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | Finished updating object references in 242887 ms
2021-07-08 11:40:27,823 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-4] | NVD>>> Finished import with id 17 of type insight-cve-import at time 2021-07-08T11:40:27.823297. Import took 1040906 ms
{code}

No blocked threads but attached threads below are often accompanied with high CPU usage.
*  [^AttributeValuePredicateBase.txt] 
*  [^InsightIndexBase.txt] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Saved export path in Discovery Tool 3.1.1 does not persist. After a day or more, the path becomes empty and results in zip files not being transferred to the expected location.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up [Insight Discovery 3.1.3|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight-discovery/latest] and the Discovery Tool 3.1.1.
 # Configure the Export with FileCopy method as per [this guide|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight-discovery/latest/discovery-documentation/set-up-discovery/export]. (!) This could also affect any other export type.
 # Test with a manual scan and verify that the scan result (zip file) is exported to the saved path as expected.
 # After a day or two, run a scan again and check if the scan result is exported to the saved path like it did.
 # Check the Export settings and verify if the Export path still exist.

h3. Expected Results
Without any intended changes made to the Export path, the setting should persist and at the end of the scan, the zip file should be exported to the saved path as expected
{code}
...
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : Start transport process.
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : Transferring file 85057_Single scan_2021-07-08_1007_0213.zip to export path C:\Users\Administrator\Downloads\Discovery import
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : File was successfully transferred.
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : Transferring file 85057_Single scan_2021-07-08_1043_0442.zip to export path C:\Users\Administrator\Downloads\Discovery import
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : File was successfully transferred.
7/8/2021 10:43:24 AM : Finished transport process.
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The saved Export path disappears after a day or 2. This does not impact the Discovery scan itself but it affects the subsequent Discovery import to Insight, as there will be no file in the expected export path for the import
 !image-2021-07-08-10-28-44-035.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
...
7/8/2021 10:07:33 AM : Start transport process.
7/8/2021 10:07:33 AM : No .zip files found.
7/8/2021 10:07:33 AM : Finished transport process.
{code}

h3. Workaround
The scanned result can be found in the _scans_ folder of the Discovery installation folder, as it will be first saved in the _scans_ folder for packaging into a zip file and then exported. Possible workarounds are
* manually copy the zip file from the _scans_ folder
* have a custom script in the server to copy the zip file from the _scans_ folder to the targeted location automatically
fields.summary: Saved export path in Discovery Tool 3.1.1 does not persist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Printing labels yields different results when printing from an object schema view, compared to printing from general "Search for objects" bulk screen.

This is specifically problematic when using dedicated QR label printer (e.g. 2.5cm x 2.5cm in size).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to specific Insight object schema configuration > Templates > create a template that fits for printing 2.5cm x 2.5cm labels. Save the template
 # Find / filter objects to be printed > bulk edit cog > Print labels
# Tweak printer dialog / scaling options to achieve best possible print settings

h3. Expected Results
The labels are printed correctly, each label on every page.

h3. Actual Results
It is not possible to print all labels correctly:
* Some of the labels are broken over several pages
* Some labels are not visible / missing (pages are blank)
* Scaling does not help to achieve good page breaking and proper printing.

Examples of resulting print previews:
 !image-2021-07-07-13-51-29-211.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-07-07-13-52-16-417.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use "Search for objects" bulk menu to print labels:
# Go to Insight > Search for objects
# Filter the assets with IQL > Bulk > Print labels
# The overview will give the exact look of the printout > click Print > modify the print dialog settings if needed.

Example of better, expected print preview:
 !image-2021-07-07-13-54-06-610.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
It seems like printing functionality is achieved in a different ways in Insight code, when printing within a single object schema, compared to using "Search for objects" bulk dialog.
The latter one works fine, without issues, and the object schema-specific printing functionality should work the same way.
fields.summary: Printing labels yields different results when printing from an object schema view, compared to printing from general "Search for objects" bulk screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* We have multiple Jira Service Management projects in our company. In the main customer portal, you can find all portals a customer has access to.
 * Usually though, our users approach the customer portal of a specific JSM directly (in this example: JSM “A", they don’t go to the main portal.
 * Here, they start looking for a certain answer in the knowledge base.
 * They also look into the previous request, via the page ”Requests”. Top right in the screen. For example, to see if they can find the answer in a previous request he/she raised or participated in.
 * If they cannot find an answer here, they want to move on and raise a new request in JSM “A”.
 * From this "Request" page though, they have to navigate to the Main customer portal first, en then to JSM “A”. 

Suggestion from our users: can we approach the last visited JSM directly from the “Request” page, without navigating tot he Main portal first? For example via Bread crumbs, or by showing the last visited JSM on this page?
fields.summary: Link to last visited JSM on the (my) Request page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing an import in Insight, the reference to an object is not occurs when the value of the data allocator has a dot and also ends with a backslash (example: *files.xxx.yyy\ABC\*).
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an Object Type and add an asset where the name value (or any other attribute used in the import mapping) has a dot and ends with a backslash character (example: *files.xxx.yyy\ABC\*)
|!image-2021-07-02-16-33-50-362.png|width=984,height=188!|

2. Create another Object Type referencing to the first Object Type;
|!image-2021-07-02-16-34-38-671.png|width=985,height=202!|

3. Create a CSV import configuration with the regular mapping;
|!image-2021-07-02-16-35-08-427.png|width=738,height=267!|

4. The data allocator that contains backslash at the end does not create a reference to the existing object;
|!image-2021-07-02-16-37-55-628.png!|
|!image-2021-07-02-16-38-33-232.png|width=916,height=195!|
h3. Expected Results

Create a reference to the object.
h3. Actual Results
 * No reference is created to the object;
 * No error occurs in the Insight UI import;
 * No error in the Insight import logs.

h3. Workaround

Use attribute in the Object Mapping (IQL) that does not have any value that ends with a backslash.
fields.summary: Object Mapping (IQL) does not create the object reference when "Data Allocator" had a dot (.) and also ends with a backslash (\) character

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sorting objects by update does not work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an objectType that has many objects which has been updated at different times.
 # Sort the objects either by basic search or using IQL to sort by update. When the result comes you will see that there is no order, you have to click the top of the column, on "updated" to sort them.

h3. Expected Results

The objects should appear in ascending or descending order.
h3. Actual Results

There is no order, you can see the higher or lower values are not order by time or date.
h3. Workaround

Do a IQL search or basic search and order the objects by pressing the updated column.
fields.summary: Sort by updated in detail view, objects Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After editing some object attributes, the object history shows entries for Date type attributes that didn't have any changes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) This can be reproduced but intermittently and it does not affect every object.
 # Make sure an object type has 2 Date type attributes.
 # Create 10-20 objects and fill in most attributes except 1 of the Date type attributes.
 # Edit these objects to fill in the other Date type attributes.
 # Check the object history.

h3. Expected Results
* The object history only contains actual changes that were made by user. For example,
{quote}
Changed the `T-shirt size` to `M` (was `S`)
{quote}
* The first Date type attribute that was already filled during the object creation and didn't have any change do not appear in the object history of the Edit action

h3. Actual Results
In the object history, there are also entries for Date attributes that weren't changed at all. And this entry gets added every time the object is edited for any attributes. For example,
{quote}
Changed the `Employment start date` to `1 Jan 2021` (was `1 Jan 2021`) 
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: After editing some object attributes, the object history shows entries for Date type attributes that didn't have any changes

fields.description:
Users of Insight often encounter issues with having to many duplicate objects in their object schemas. There needs to be a way to find duplicate objects with IQL. I am suggesting an improvement for SQL scripts to be able to find duplicates.

*The workaround that currently exists is the following*

What you can do at the moment, using IQL:

a. Visually locate a duplicated Object.

b. identify the Duplicate from the Original (the object id of the original will be lower than the duplicate, and reflected in the numeric part of the object Key, e.g. KEY-123 = original while KEY-234 is a duplicate as objectId: 123<234 )

c. If there are a few duplicates, locate the oldest one - and note the Created date & Time

d. Use the Insight object search to filter on your All your Schema Objects Created from the Duplicate Create date onward, e.g. IQL: Created >= 29/Jun/2020 05:36:00

e. Note that some objects may have been created legitimately and ARE NOT Duplicates, hence you should carefully revise the filtered objects, before deleting any.

f. we strongly recommend to create a Jira/DB Backup before you start deleting any object - to allow a valid restore point. As deleting Objects is irreversible unless you restore a backup.

However working with very high volumes of objects makes this workaround not sufficient. 

Kind regards
Thomas
fields.summary: Insight, make IQL able to detect duplicates.

fields.description:
If an Insight CF has a placeholder in it's Filter Issue Scope, pointing to a User Picker CF:
Manager = ${customfield_nnnnn}

(Manager is a User Type Attribute, customfield.nnnnn is a User Picker, tested also with ${customfield_nnnnn.key})
On the Create Screen The User Picker seems to keep a Username as its interim value.
So if User "UserA" with username "myuser" and userKey "JIRAUSER123456" is selected in the user picker, Insight will not find any object as the IQL will attempt:
Manager = "myuser" - while the expected object has Manager = JIRAUSER123456 ...
No User lookup is executed in this case.
This leads to an edge case, when a User was previously created in Jira 7.n:
If I had "AnotherUser" created in Jira 7.n with an initial username: "MyUser", it will have the userKey "myuser".

If I select "UserA" in the User Picker, Insight will show any object where Manager = "myuser" (userKey) which means, the wrong objects, where Manager is "AnotherUser" and NOT "UserA"...

Insight must execute a User lookup. It will not resolve the edge case, but will resolve the initial issue, where no objects are returned where userName != userKey ...
fields.summary: User Lookup when a User Type Attribute is matched in a CF IQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Post function "Change Insight Value into Insight Object" cannot remove the only linked object.

This applies if we have an object and referring other objects with an attribute (type: Object):
 !image-2021-06-30-15-43-18-600.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Object Type "Software"
# Create Object Type "Server"
# In "Software" object Attributes screen > create attribute "Server" with type Object:
 !image-2021-06-30-15-45-05-436.png|thumbnail! 
# Create one "Software" object and one "Server" object
# On the "Software" object, set "Server" attribute value to point to the newly created "Server" object
# Create two Insight custom fields "Application" and "Server" - example configurations: 
 !image-2021-06-30-15-47-19-256.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-06-30-15-47-38-951.png|thumbnail! 
# Associate those 2 fields with a project's screens
# Edit the project workflow > add a post function "Change Insight Value into Insight Object" that will remove reference to object found in "Server" custom field, from the specified object defined in "Application" custom field:
 !image-2021-06-30-15-49-53-995.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the workflow
# Create a test issue and fill "Application" and "Server" fields' values:
 !image-2021-06-30-15-51-05-437.png|thumbnail! 
# Trigger the transition that will execute the post function, which will remove the selected object reference as found in "Server" field.

h3. Expected Results
The referenced object value gets removed and there are no any other referenced values.

h3. Actual Results
* If there are 2 or more referenced objects in "Server" object attribute, the post function will work and it will remove the desired object reference.
* If there is only a single referenced object (only 1 left), this one will not get removed. The following gets logged in atlassian-jira.log:
{noformat}
2021-06-30 09:12:50,302+0000 http-nio-8133-exec-6 WARN admin 552x2101x1 1yro3gt 172.29.220.20 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.r.j.p.i.s.jira.workflow.InsightWorkflowFunction] Post function could not execute: ValidationInsightException: Validation errors were found: rlabs-insight-attribute-2490: ErrorMessage{i18nKey='rlabs.insight.i18n.constraint.violation.ObjectAttributeValueBean.MinOne.value', parameters=[], additionalMessage=null};
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Remove the referenced objects with a custom Groovy script, that will be triggered in scope of "Run a groovy script within this transition" Insight post-function.
fields.summary: Post function "Change Insight Value into Insight Object" cannot remove the only linked object

fields.description:
Hey Team,

Customers have a specific requirement where they prefer to set the value of an attribute in an object-type to a certain value depending the import configuration used (specific use case is for SCCM import but applies to other imports as well) when using multiple import configurations in action which are updating same object-type.

*Use Case:* Consider we have an object-type namely "*Desktop*" and attribute "*Type*".
 - If this is imported by the import configuration 1, then value of attribute "*Type*" should be set to "*Internal*".
 - If this is imported by configuration 2, then "*Type*" should be set to "*External*".
 (This is an example scenario, however real life values might vary based on scenario).

With Insight automation rules this is not achievable as this needs an (IQL) or identifier to set the values based on values in source data (but requirement is to update based on import configuration). Any other workarounds or solutions if exists, they are welcome and much appreciated.

Thanks and Regards.
fields.summary: Possibility to set a value for an attribute depending the import configuration used

fields.description:
As Jira Data Center with Insight supports new feature of Insight and Bitbucket integration through add on "Insight Jira & Bitbucket Integration" which helps users to import the Bitbucket environment as part of object schema import.

Reference Link to Plugin: [JIRA & Bitbucket integration|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217750/insight-jira-bitbucket-integration?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]

This integration creates an insight asset scheme listing all configurations from JIRA to insight objects (workflows, schemes, etc) as part of Bitbucket environment Import. We can see for example project and all the configurations related to project in one look.

Integration works fine and is very good based on customer feedback, but it is missing priority schemes. This is the feature customers would like to leverage, and this will be a good value add too if we can enable the feature to import priority schemes as well.

Hope to see this feature soon in upcoming Insight versions.
Thanks.
fields.summary: Insight Jira and Bitbucket Integration is missing priority schemes from the Integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Right now, the only way to check if a user is using up a JSM agent license is through *Jira Administration >> Applications >> Application access* and cross checking the groups' members who are assigned. The Jira Administrator needs to be involved in this check.
The mapping between the jira-servicedesk-agents group (or any group with application access to JSM to take up an agent's license) and a project's team/role is not readily viewable at the project settings level.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a filterable column under *Project settings >> Users and roles* showing the user groups that a user is assigned. This way, a project administrator can check at the project settings level the number of users who are taking up an agent license without having to approach a Jira system administrator.

h3. Why This Is Important
This will reduce the need for a Jira administrator to perform a simple check, and empower project owners/admins to view which users in their respective projects are taking up an agent license.

h3. Workaround
Jira admins still need to be involved to identify the users who take up an agent license. Once step 1 and 2 are recorded, the project admins can do step 3 on their own moving forward.

# Jira admin: Check *Jira Administration >> Applications >> Application access*. Note down the groups assigned to Jira Service Desk.
# Jira admin: Navigate to *Jira Administration >> System >> Project roles*. Check each Project role's default members to see if the group from step 1 is assigned to a project role. Note down the project roles with default group members from step 1.
# Project admin/Project settings: Go to *Project settings >> Users and roles*. Filter by the project roles from step 2. This will list all users who have an agent license.
fields.summary: User License Usage in Jira Service Management Project Settings

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the introduction of new object view, there's a change in the object attachment URL. Users are no longer able to share a preview link to object attachment images. This used to work in old object view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install newer Insight version v8.7.x or 9.0.x
 # Add [an attachment image|https://png.pngtree.com/png-clipart/20190705/original/pngtree-jpeg-file-document-icon-png-image_4230293.jpg] to any object
# Copy the URL of the attachment and open it in a new tab

h3. Expected Results
Users get to see the image on the browser itself
h3. Actual Results
The attachment is downloaded in the local computer

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes:

Tested in-house on Insight *v8.3.4*. The object attachment link used to be something which doesn't download images but shows on the browser like Jira attachments.
 * URL pattern on *v8.3.4*:
{noformat}
http://XXXXXXXXXX/plugins/servlet/com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight/attachment/1/<IMAGE.JPEG>
{noformat}

 * URL pattern on Insight *v9.0.2*:
{noformat}
http://XXXXXXX/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/3
{noformat}

(!) So looks like it's definitely something which changed with the new object page. The attachment link changed from a servlet to direct REST API.
fields.summary: Add the ability to share Object attachment image URL so that it doesn't download the file (Regression)
